definition: abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)
to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)

sentences.english: We have freedom of speech to prove it.
sentences.chinese: 我們有言論自由，以證明這一點。

sentences.english: They were fighting for freedom of speech and freedom of assembly.
sentences.chinese: 他們在爲言論自由和集會自由而鬥爭。

sentences.english: The government tried to muzzle freedom of speech.
sentences.chinese: 政府試圖鉗制言論自由。

sentences.english: Like those anti-free-speechrioters in Berkeley and Portland?
sentences.chinese: 像伯克利和波蘭的反言論自由的暴民一樣？

sentences.english: It is thought to be a cornerstone of free speech on the Web.
sentences.chinese: 這被視爲是網絡言論自由的奠基石。

sentences.english: Wilders says his remarks are protected by his right to freedom of speech.
sentences.chinese: 維爾德斯說，他的言論受到言論自由權的保護。

sentences.english: The court is also expected to hear major cases involving free speech and privacy.
sentences.chinese: 法院也將聽取涉及言論自由和隱私的大案要案。

sentences.english: Open-Web and free-speech advocates immediately objected to Cameron's language.
sentences.chinese: 網絡開放和言論自由的支持者迅速反對卡梅倫的言論。

sentences.english: These questions ask us to consider freedom of speech.
sentences.chinese: 這些問題讓我們開始考慮言論自由的問題。

sentences.english: Wilders : It's a very sad day for freedom of speech in the UK .
sentences.chinese: 它在英國爲了言論自由是非常難過的一天。

sentences.english: For me, that's the context for all of this.
sentences.chinese: 對我來說，這就是美國言論自由的背景。

sentences.english: There is a myth that freedom of speech has been safely protected in England by the jury.
sentences.chinese: 英國陪審團曾創造了安全的保護了言論自由的神話。

sentences.english: Norwegians pride themselves on the openness of their society and cherish the idea of free expression.
sentences.chinese: 挪威人以他們的社會開發性而自豪，並崇尚言論自由。

sentences.english: He is wrong not to allow Umno to speak their minds.
sentences.chinese: 他不讓巫統會員有言論自由是不對的。

sentences.english: Sorry I am to hear the liberty of speech in this House imputed as a crime.
sentences.chinese: 我十分遺憾地聽到言論自由在下院被判定爲一種罪行。

definition: right (i.e. an entitlement to sth)/(classical) power and wealth
to deprive/to expropriate/to strip (sb of his property)
Cross-Strait Service Trade Agreement/abbr. for 兩岸服務貿易協議|两岸服务贸易协议[Liang3 an4 Fu2 wu4 Mao4 yi4 Xie2 yi4]
to ignore/to neglect/to treat with contempt
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
Taiwan independence/(of Taiwan) to declare independence
